title: Evaluate github-token-manager operator for production use
description:
Evaluate github-token-manager Kubernetes operator as production alternative to custom sidecar.

Research findings show github-token-manager provides:
- Zero-trust: private keys stored in cloud KMS (AWS, GCP, Azure, Vault)
- Automatic token refresh (default 45 min)
- Custom Token/ClusterToken CRDs
- Production-ready error handling and monitoring
- Works like cert-manager for GitHub tokens

Evaluation tasks:
1. Test installation via Helm chart
2. Verify KMS integration options
3. Test token generation with repository scoping
4. Compare vs custom sidecar approach
5. Document pros/cons for this project
6. Create example configurations

Deliverable:

- If operator chosen: Update Helm chart to optionally use operator
- Example configurations for both patterns

URL: https://github.com/isometry/github-token-manager

title: Add repository-scoped token generation wrapper
description:
Create wrapper script for generating repository-scoped GitHub App tokens.

Problem: Existing CLI tools (gh-token, gha-token, etc.) don't support --repositories parameter.

Solution: Write wrapper that:
1. Uses gh-token or gha-token to get base token
2. Adds repositories parameter to GitHub API call
3. Returns scoped installation token

API endpoint:
POST /app/installations/{installation_id}/access_tokens
Body: {"repositories": ["repo-a", "repo-b"]}

The wrapper will be used by:
- InitContainer for initial token generation
- Sidecar for token refresh with workspace-specific repo scoping

Implementation:
- Shell script wrapper around gh-token
- Or Go/Python library integration
- Support reading repos from environment variable or CLI args

Reference: Research agent output on CLI tools comparison

title: Implement GitHub App authentication in Helm chart
description:
Add GitHub App support to the Helm chart as an alternative to interactive gh auth login.

Based on research:
- Support workspace-specific repository-scoped tokens
- Single GitHub App installation can generate different tokens per workspace
- Each token scoped to only the repos configured for that workspace
- Tokens expire after 1 hour, need sidecar for refresh

Implementation requirements:
- Add GitHub App secret support (app-id, installation-id, private-key)
- Create token refresh sidecar container (45-min refresh interval)
- Use emptyDir volume with medium: Memory for token sharing
- Support repository scoping via workspace.repos configuration
- Document GitHub App creation and setup process

Files to modify:
- chart/happy-little-claude-coders/values.yaml
- chart/happy-little-claude-coders/templates/deployment.yaml
- chart/happy-little-claude-coders/templates/secret.yaml
- README.md

Reference: history/GITHUB_APP_SETUP_GUIDE.md

title: Build token refresh sidecar container image
description:
Create a container image for the GitHub App token refresh sidecar.

Based on research:
- Sidecar refreshes tokens every 45-50 minutes (before 1-hour expiration)
- Writes tokens to shared emptyDir volume (tmpfs)
- Implements retry logic with exponential backoff
- Uses native Kubernetes sidecar pattern (restartPolicy: Always)

Implementation options researched:
1. Go-based using bradleyfalzon/ghinstallation library
2. Python-based using PyGithub
3. Use existing github-token-manager operator (production option)

Recommendation: Start with Go implementation for minimal dependencies.

Deliverables:
- Dockerfile for sidecar
- Token refresh script (Go or Python)
- Health check endpoints
- Helm chart integration
- Documentation

Reference research in completed agent outputs.
